results.title: Shower = Xizhao
results.creator_credit: Peter Loehr, Imar Film Co, Xi'an Film Studio and Yang Zhang
results.brief_description: This sentimental family drama/comedy from Yang Zhang is set amid the ritualistic world of the Chinese bathhouse and has as its central conflict, family tradition and difference between generations. Da Ming is a businessman, happily ensconced in city ways, who receives a cryptic card from his mentally-handicapped, but exuberant and eternally happy brother, Er Ming. Fearing the worst, Da returns home to find his father contentedly running the local bathhouse, in a decaying neighbourhood of Beijing, and also acting as marriage counsellor and mediator to the many petty quarrels that abound within the male dominated arena. Although urbanised, Da’s ties to the ways of his family and background are rekindled. The bathhouse is more or less a character in itself - it serves as a meeting place for men, especially the elderly, who engage in the bathing practices, including suction cups, massage and shaving, whilst discussing the minutiae of life, and blissfully engaging in ceremonies steeped in old world values, keeping the time-pressed pace of modernisation at bay. At times the tone of the film is cloying, but the overall impression is one of a lilting comedy that speaks of China’s contemporary cultural issues examined within the experience of one small family. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Shout it out numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animated geometric shapes and music to illustrate numbers from one to ten. Triangles, circles, and squares transform into animals, trains, suns, see-saws and other familiar objects.

results.title: Shotput
results.brief_description: Basic techniques have changed over time in relation to shotput. Action shots broken down into steps show correct use of body tension to maximise throws. Good quality instruction film.

results.title: Shot sizes and framing faults: Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Gives working definitions of shot sizes, and shows common framing faults, and how they can be corrected. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson. From the “Lessons in visual language” series.

results.title: Shortspell
results.creator_credit: Kinetic Film Enterprises and Stuart Wynn Jones
results.brief_description: An animated review of the alphabet in which each letter becomes a picture and each picture becomes the next letter. Both sound and picture are drawn directly onto the film by the artist.

results.title: Shorter cuts: Supergeek 2
results.creator_credit: Annemaree O'Brien and Anderson's Creek Primary School
results.brief_description: From the ACMI Primary School Program “Supergeek 2: Shorter Cuts Episode”. In the program, Middle Year Students script and shoot scenes for an episode of Shorter Cuts, based on the Burberry Productions TV series Short Cuts. The program was developed in collaboration with Burberry Productions, with assistance from Film Victoria and Seven Network.

results.title: Short tall story
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and John Halas
results.brief_description: Charming allegorical film about the role of the United Nations in resolving disputes: Separated by a bank of cloud, the short people and tall people are becoming increasingly ill-disposed to each other. Failing to resolve the dispute on their own, the U.N. Fairy is enlisted to their aid, and the cloud dividing the conflicting parties are driven aside.
